subject: Design
title: The Victorian Parlor: Clutter as Virtue
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Victorian Parlor: Clutter as Virtue.

hook.text: Victorian homes crammed every surface with objects. Empty space was considered lazy and immoral.

buildup.text: Tables had fringed cloths, walls were packed with paintings, and shelves overflowed with ornaments.

discovery.text: Mass production made decorative objects cheap. Displaying many objects proved you could afford them.

twist.text: Victorians covered piano legs with fabric because exposed legs were considered indecent. Even furniture legs.

climax.text: Victorian clutter was a moral statement: a full home meant a full, industrious, respectable life.

punchline.text: Every era's clutter is the next era's minimalism inspiration.

quiz.question: Why were Victorian interiors so heavily decorated?
options: Displaying objects showed morality and wealth
